CatDescriptText: Edna Seay, housewife, 224 Whitridge Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you favor an increase in state sales tax or a graduated income tax as a means of raising revenue for a commonwealth of Pennsylvania?" answer reads: "I prefer an increased sales tax because if I do not want to buy articles which are taxable, I don't have to do so. As far as I'm concerned, anything will be all right except an income tax."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Edna Seay wearing dark coat with folded and buttoned collar, and hoop earrings, posed in front of shop window with religious figurines, vases, and flowers
